item.title: Manipulate Unicode in Go
item.description: We work with string every day. We work we character sets every day. But how much do we know about ASCII, UTF-8, Unicode? There is the Caesar cipher method: The method in which each letter in the plaintext is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet. The method is named after Julius Caesar, who used it in his private correspondence. Assume we have “hello worldz” and want encode it with shifting by 1.
